Load single-cell data

Source: R/data_loading.R
load_data.Rd

Loads single-cell data from a directory containing count matrix, metadata, and barcodes. First attempts to use the shell script for file preparation, falling back to R-based preparation if the script fails. Automatically validates malformed input files.

Usage

load_data(
  data_dir,
  experiment_id,
  use_shell_script = TRUE,
  metadata_file = NULL,
  counts_file = NULL,
  min_cells = 3,
  min_features = 200,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

data_dir

Character string specifying the directory containing the data files. The directory should contain files with the following naming pattern:

  • <experiment_id>_metadata.csv - Cell metadata file

  • <experiment_id>_counts.csv - Gene expression count matrix

experiment_id

Character string specifying the experiment ID prefix in filenames. This should match the prefix used in your data files.

use_shell_script

Logical indicating whether to use shell script for file preparation. If TRUE, attempts to use shell script first, falling back to R-based preparation if it fails. Default is TRUE.

metadata_file

Character string specifying the name of the metadata file. If NULL, will be automatically detected based on experiment_id.

counts_file

Character string specifying the name of the counts file. If NULL, will be automatically detected based on experiment_id.

min_cells

Integer specifying the minimum number of cells expressing a gene for the gene to be included. Default is 3.

min_features

Integer specifying the minimum number of genes expressed in a cell for the cell to be included. Default is 200.

verbose

Logical indicating whether to print progress messages. Default is TRUE.

Value

A Seurat object containing:

  • Count matrix in the counts slot

  • Cell metadata in the meta.data slot

  • Filtered genes and cells based on min_cells and min_features

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Validates input parameters and file existence

  2. Automatically detects metadata and counts files if not specified

  3. Loads and validates metadata and counts data

  4. Checks for data consistency (matching cell numbers)

  5. Creates a Seurat object with appropriate filtering

See also

preprocess_data for preprocessing the loaded data reduce_dimensions for dimensionality reduction

Examples

# Example with temporary files
# Create temporary directory and files
temp_dir <- tempdir()
exp_id <- "test_exp"

# Create mock counts file
counts_data <- matrix(rpois(500, 5), nrow = 50)
rownames(counts_data) <- paste0("Gene", seq_len(50))
colnames(counts_data) <- paste0("Cell", seq_len(10))
counts_file <- file.path(temp_dir, paste0(exp_id, "_counts.csv"))
write.csv(counts_data, counts_file)

# Create mock metadata file
metadata <- data.frame(
    cell_id = colnames(counts_data),
    sample = rep(c("Sample1", "Sample2"), each = 5)
)
metadata_file <- file.path(temp_dir, paste0(exp_id, "_metadata.csv"))
write.csv(metadata, metadata_file, row.names = FALSE)

# Load the data
seurat_obj <- load_data(
    data_dir = temp_dir,
    experiment_id = exp_id,
    use_shell_script = FALSE
)
#> Detecting data format...
#> CSV format detected
#> Loading CSV format data...
#> Loading counts data...
#> Creating Seurat object...
#> Warning: Data is of class data.frame. Coercing to dgCMatrix.
#> Error in value[[3L]](cond): Error creating Seurat object: invalid class “LogMap” object: Rownames must be supplied

# Clean up
unlink(counts_file)
unlink(metadata_file)
